ar.com.hjg.pngj

Class ChunkSeqSkipping

  • java.lang.Object
    • ar.com.hjg.pngj.ChunkSeqReader
      • ar.com.hjg.pngj.ChunkSeqSkipping
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBytesConsumer, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class ChunkSeqSkipping
extends ChunkSeqReader
    This simple reader skips all chunks contents and stores the chunkRaw in a list. Useful to read chunks structure. Optionally the contents might be processed. This doesn't distinguish IDAT chunks

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class ar.com.hjg.pngj.ChunkSeqReader

        closed, endChunkDone, signatureDone

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChunkSeqSkipping() 
      ChunkSeqSkipping(boolean skipAll) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected ChunkReader createChunkReaderForNewChunk(String id, int len, long offset, boolean skip)
      This will be called for all chunks (even skipped), except for IDAT-like non-skiped chunks The default behaviour is to create a ChunkReader in BUFFER mode (or SKIP if skip==true) that calls ChunkSeqReader.postProcessChunk(ChunkReader) (always) when done.
      protected DeflatedChunksSet createIdatSet(String id)
      DeflatedChunksSet factory.
      List<ChunkRaw> getChunks() 
      protected boolean isIdatKind(String id)
      Decides if this Chunk is of "IDAT" kind (in concrete: if it is, and if it's not to be skiped, a DeflatedChunksSet will be created to deflate it and process+ the deflated data) This implementation always returns always false
      protected void postProcessChunk(ChunkReader chunkR)
      This is called after a chunk is read, in all modes This implementation only chenks the id of the first chunk, and process the IEND chunk (sets done=true) Further processing should be overriden (call this first!)
      protected void processChunkContent(ChunkRaw chunkRaw, int offsetinChhunk, byte[] buf, int off, int len) 
      protected boolean shouldSkipContent(int len, String id)
      Chunks can be skipped depending on id and/or length.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChunkSeqSkipping

        public ChunkSeqSkipping(boolean skipAll)
        Parameters:
        skipAll - if true, contents will be truly skipped, and CRC will not be computed

    • Method Detail

      • createChunkReaderForNewChunk

        protected ChunkReader createChunkReaderForNewChunk(String id,
                                                   int len,
                                                   long offset,
                                                   boolean skip)
        Description copied from class: ChunkSeqReader
        This will be called for all chunks (even skipped), except for IDAT-like non-skiped chunks The default behaviour is to create a ChunkReader in BUFFER mode (or SKIP if skip==true) that calls ChunkSeqReader.postProcessChunk(ChunkReader) (always) when done.
        Overrides:
        createChunkReaderForNewChunk in class ChunkSeqReader
        Parameters:
        id - Chunk id
        len - Chunk length
        offset - offset inside PNG stream , merely informative
        skip - flag: is true, the content will not be buffered (nor processed)
        Returns:
        a newly created ChunkReader that will create the ChunkRaw and then discarded

      • processChunkContent

        protected void processChunkContent(ChunkRaw chunkRaw,
                                   int offsetinChhunk,

      • postProcessChunk

        protected void postProcessChunk(ChunkReader chunkR)
        Description copied from class: ChunkSeqReader
        This is called after a chunk is read, in all modes This implementation only chenks the id of the first chunk, and process the IEND chunk (sets done=true) Further processing should be overriden (call this first!)
        Overrides:
        postProcessChunk in class ChunkSeqReader

      • shouldSkipContent

        protected boolean shouldSkipContent(int len,
                                    String id)
        Description copied from class: ChunkSeqReader
        Chunks can be skipped depending on id and/or length. Skipped chunks are still processed, but their data will be null, and CRC will never checked
        Overrides:
        shouldSkipContent in class ChunkSeqReader

      • isIdatKind

        protected boolean isIdatKind(String id)
        Description copied from class: ChunkSeqReader
        Decides if this Chunk is of "IDAT" kind (in concrete: if it is, and if it's not to be skiped, a DeflatedChunksSet will be created to deflate it and process+ the deflated data) This implementation always returns always false
        Overrides:
        isIdatKind in class ChunkSeqReader

      • getChunks

        public List<ChunkRaw> getChunks()

      • createIdatSet

        protected DeflatedChunksSet createIdatSet(String id)
        Description copied from class: ChunkSeqReader
        DeflatedChunksSet factory. This implementation is quite dummy, it usually should be overriden.
        Specified by:
        createIdatSet in class ChunkSeqReader
